Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface MathematicalFunction

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable, SimpleFunction
@Immutable public interface MathematicalFunction extends Serializable, SimpleFunction
A mathematical function that can be evaluated at runtime. This is used to represent functions that are defined by the user as part of the configuration of the model, such as the viral load to transmission probability mapping.

The function is defined by a String expression containing `x` as the parameter, which is parsed and evaluated using the mXparser library. The parsed expression is derived from the original String and is not serialized, ensuring that only the user-defined expression is stored in the configuration.

See Also:
  • OutbreakBaseline.transmissibilityFromViralLoad(double, double)

  • Method Details

    • getFXExpression

      String getFXExpression()
      A univariate mathematical function as a String containing `x` as the parameter. Supported expressions are described here: https://mathparser.org/mxparser-math-collection
      Returns:
      the function expression.

    • getParsed

      @Derived default org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Expression getParsed()
      The parsed expression ready for evaluation. This is derived from the `fxExpression` and is not serialized. It is configured to disable rounding to ensure accurate calculations.
      Returns:
      the parsed expression.

    • getXArgument

      @Derived default org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Argument getXArgument()
      The following methods are derived from the expression and are not serialized. They provide a convenient way to evaluate the function at runtime.
      Returns:
      the argument representing `x`.

    • value

      default double value(double x)
      Evaluates the function at a given value of `x`.
      Specified by:
      value in interface SimpleFunction
      Parameters:
      x - the value to evaluate the function at.
      Returns:
      the result of the function evaluation.
